questions.question: Choose the correct form of the verb: 'She ___ (run) every morning.'
questions.explanation: The correct form of the verb is 'runs'. 'She runs every morning.'

questions.question: Choose the correct form of the verb: 'They ___ (eat) dinner now.'
questions.explanation: The correct form of the verb is 'are eating'. 'They are eating dinner now.'

questions.question: Choose the correct form of the verb: 'He ___ (go) to the gym every day.'
questions.explanation: The correct form of the verb is 'goes'. 'He goes to the gym every day.'

questions.question: Choose the correct form of the verb: 'We ___ (watch) a movie last night.'
questions.explanation: The correct form of the verb is 'watched'. 'We watched a movie last night.'

questions.question: Choose the correct form of the verb: 'She ___ (write) a letter now.'
questions.explanation: The correct form of the verb is 'is writing'. 'She is writing a letter now.'

questions.question: Choose the correct form of the verb: 'They ___ (play) football every Saturday.'
questions.explanation: The correct form of the verb is 'play'. 'They play football every Saturday.'

questions.question: Choose the correct form of the verb: 'He ___ (read) a book when I saw him.'
questions.explanation: The correct form of the verb is 'was reading'. 'He was reading a book when I saw him.'

questions.question: Choose the correct form of the verb: 'We ___ (go) to the park every Sunday.'
questions.explanation: The correct form of the verb is 'go'. 'We go to the park every Sunday.'

questions.question: Choose the correct form of the verb: 'She ___ (finish) her homework already.'
questions.explanation: The correct form of the verb is 'has finished'. 'She has finished her homework already.'

questions.question: Choose the correct form of the verb: 'They ___ (live) in this city for five years.'
questions.explanation: The correct form of the verb is 'have lived'. 'They have lived in this city for five years.'

questions.question: Choose the correct form of the verb: 'He ___ (cook) dinner when I arrived.'
questions.explanation: The correct form of the verb is 'was cooking'. 'He was cooking dinner when I arrived.'

questions.question: Choose the correct form of the verb: 'I ___ (see) him last week.'
questions.explanation: The correct form of the verb is 'saw'. 'I saw him last week.'

questions.question: Choose the correct form of the verb: 'We ___ (visit) the museum tomorrow.'
questions.explanation: The correct form of the verb is 'will visit'. 'We will visit the museum tomorrow.'

questions.question: Choose the correct form of the verb: 'She ___ (run) a marathon last year.'
questions.explanation: The correct form of the verb is 'ran'. 'She ran a marathon last year.'

questions.question: Choose the correct form of the verb: 'They ___ (play) chess now.'
questions.explanation: The correct form of the verb is 'are playing'. 'They are playing chess now.'

questions.question: Choose the correct form of the verb: 'He ___ (study) for the exam for two hours.'
questions.explanation: The correct form of the verb is 'has been studying'. 'He has been studying for the exam for two hours.'

questions.question: Choose the correct form of the verb: 'I ___ (eat) breakfast before I left.'
questions.explanation: The correct form of the verb is 'ate'. 'I ate breakfast before I left.'

questions.question: Choose the correct form of the verb: 'We ___ (watch) TV when it started to rain.'
questions.explanation: The correct form of the verb is 'were watching'. 'We were watching TV when it started to rain.'

questions.question: Choose the correct form of the verb: 'She ___ (finish) her homework by the time I arrived.'
questions.explanation: The correct form of the verb is 'had finished'. 'She had finished her homework by the time I arrived.'

questions.question: Choose the correct form of the verb: 'They ___ (play) football every Saturday.'
questions.explanation: The correct form of the verb is 'play'. 'They play football every Saturday.'

questions.question: Choose the correct form of the verb: 'I ___ (read) a book when you called.'
questions.explanation: The correct form of the verb is 'was reading'. 'I was reading a book when you called.'

questions.question: Choose the correct form of the verb: 'She ___ (visit) her grandparents next week.'
questions.explanation: The correct form of the verb is 'will visit'. 'She will visit her grandparents next week.'

questions.question: Choose the correct form of the verb: 'They ___ (live) here since 2010.'
questions.explanation: The correct form of the verb is 'have lived'. 'They have lived here since 2010.'

questions.question: Choose the correct form of the verb: 'He ___ (work) on the project for three hours.'
questions.explanation: The correct form of the verb is 'has been working'. 'He has been working on the project for three hours.'
